introduction.p:
For Problems 1-4,
Find the x-intercepts of the parabola.
Decide whether the parabola opens up or down.
For Problems 5 and 6, write the set with interval notation, and graph the set on a number line.
For Problems 7-10, solve the inequality algebraically. Write your answers in interval notation, and round to two decimal places if necessary.
For Problems 11 and 12, solve the inequality by graphing. Use the window setting \text{Xmin} \amp = -9.4 \amp\amp \text{Xmax} = 9.4 \text{Ymin} \amp = -64 \amp\amp \text{Ymax} = 62
For Problems 13 and 14, solve the inequality algebraically. Write your answers in interval notation, and round to two decimal places if necessary.

statement.p: The x-intercepts of ~y=2x^2+bx+c are -4.2 and 2.6. What are the solutions of ~2x^2+bx+c \gt 0?

introduction.p:
For Problems 17 and 18,
Solve the problem by writing and solving an inequality.
Graph the equation and verify your solution on the graph.

statement.p: A fireworks rocket is fired from ground level. Its height in feet t seconds after launch is given by h=320t-16t^2 During what time interval is the rocket higher than 1024 feet?

The volume of a cylindrical can should be between 21.2 and 21.6 cubic inches. If the height of the can is 5 inches, what values for the radius (to the nearest hundredth of an inch) will produce an acceptable can?

introduction.p: For Problems 19 and 20, recall that \text{Revenue} = \text{(number of items sold)} \cdot \text{( price per item)}

statement.p: Green Valley Nursery sells 120-10p boxes of rose food per month at a price of p dollars per box. It would like to keep its monthly revenue from rose food over $350. In what range should it price a box of rose food?

The Locker Room finds that it sells 1200-30p sweatshirts each month when it chargespdollars per sweatshirt. It would like its revenue from sweatshirts to be over $9000 per month. In what range should it keep the price of a sweatshirt?
